alert.note: Alert for Lamoille (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:58AM EST until December 19 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Lamoille River At Jeffersonville affecting Lamoille County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lamoille River at Jeffersonville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 447.0 feet, The Lamoille River will begin to leave its banks around Jeffersonville and downstream through Cambridge Village. Persons with interests in the floodplain, such as farmers, campers and seasonal canoe and kayak operators should move their equipment to higher ground. At 450.0 feet, Water will rise to near the edge of Route 15 in Cambridge Village at the Wrong Way Bridge. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. At 451.0 feet, Water will cover Route 15 in Cambridge Village at the Wrong Way Bridge. Traffic diversions may be necessary, and motorists planning to travel route 15 through Cambridge should allow extra time to detour around the flooded roadway. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. At 451.5 feet, Route 15 in Cambridge becomes impassable. Traffic diversions will be required, and motorists planning to travel Route 15 through Cambridge should allow extra time to detour around the flooded roadway. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 447.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 452.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 450.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight EST.
